options.description: bars rendered on the y axis (column chart)
bars rendered on the x axis

default.description: bars sorted as they appear in data

options.description: Toggles whether to categorically color nodes.
Width in px to set the nodes in the alluvial, leverages d3-sankey's node width.
Spacing in px to add between nodes vertically, leverages d3-sankey's node padding.
Leverages d3-sankey's node alignment functionality, options are 'left', 'right', 'center', or 'justify'.
Toggles whether to vertically, bottom align nodes for easier horizontal comparison. The alignment is computed strictly based on node order.

Toggles whether to horizontally space nodes and render links in between them. Passing false will remove links from the view and bring nodes closer together for easier comparison, we suggest also using nodeConfig.compare in this scenario.
Determines how to color links in the alluvial, options are 'group' (requires groupAccessor), 'source', 'target', 'link', or, 'none'.
Sets opacity of links in the alluvial.
Sets the opacity of the reference element
Sets the color of the reference element (may use visa colors or any CSS color input)
Sets the stroke width of the reference element
Sets the dash pattern for the reference line (use numbers separated by spaces, EG 3 2)
Sets the opacity of the fit line
Sets the color of the fit line (may use visa colors or any CSS color input)
Sets the stroke width of the fit line
Sets the dash pattern for the fit line (use numbers separated by spaces, EG 3 2)
Sets the color of the hovered element (requires onHoverEvent to be set)
Sets the opacity of the hovered element (requires onHoverEvent to be set)
Sets the stroke width of the hovered element (requires onHoverEvent to be set)
Toggles whether to show markers on map
Toggles whether to color scale the markers based on valueAccessor (requires markerAccessor)
Toggles whether to use css blending mode (true = multiply, false = normal)
Sets the radius of the markers on the map (overwritten by radiusRange)
Sets the range for the radius scale for the markers on the map (overwrites radius)
Sets the opacity of the markers on the map
Sets the color of the marker if fill is false
Sets the stroke width of the markers on the map
Toggles whether to color scale the countries based on valueAccessor (choropleth), joinAccessor required
Sets the opacity of the countries on the map
Sets the color of the countries if fill is false
Sets the stroke width of the countries on the map
Sets the color of the clicked element (requires onClickEvent to be set)
Sets the opacity of the clicked element (requires onClickEvent to be set)
Sets the stroke width of the clicked element (requires onClickEvent to be set)
Sets the line dash of the clicked element (requires onClickEvent to be set)
Sets the placement of the data label
Key that determines which property of the data is displayed in the label
Sets numeric formatting for the data label, EG 0,0.0[a]
Toggles the data label
Toggles whether the collision algorithm will only hide (vs hide/move) labels
Sets the specified placement of labels for the collision algorithm
Key which determines the value used to size each mark
Enables dual color encoding to aid in data comprehension of size scale.
Overrides the calculated default min value for the mark size scale domain
Overrides the calculated default max value for the mark size scale domain
Overrides the calculated default min size for the mark size scale range
Overrides the calculated default max size for the mark size scale range
Sets numeric formatting for the size value, EG 0,0.0[a]
Toggles the difference label
Sets the placement of the difference label
Sets the calculation of the difference label
Sets numeric formatting for the difference label, EG 0,0.0[a]
Toggles whether the collision algorithm will only hide (vs hide/move) labels
Toggles the visibility of the x axis
Toggles the visibility of the x axis grid
Sets the label for the x axis
Sets the x axis placement as 'top' or 'bottom'
Sets the formatting for x axis elements, EG %b, refer to d3-time-format
Sets the interval for x axis ticks
Sets the unit of padding for the x axis
Toggles the visibility of the y axis
Toggles the visibility of the y axis grid
Sets the label for the y axis
Sets the formatting for y axis elements, EG %b
Sets the interval for y axis ticks
Sets the unit of padding for the y axis, EG day, week, month, or year
Sets the type of scales used in y axis
Hides yAxis ticks between min/max
Sets the y axis placement as 'left' or 'right'
Toggles the visibility of the legend
An array that sets each label in the legend, in order
Toggles the interactivity of the legend
Changes legend type, EG default, key, gradient
Sets numeric formatting for the data label, EG 0,0
Assign keys of secondary lines
Sets the visibility of data labels on secondary lines
Sets the visibility of series labels on secondary lines
Sets the opacity secondary lines
Toggles the visibility of series labels
Sets the placement of the series label
An array which determines the labels for each line, in order
Toggles whether the collision algorithm will only hide (vs hide/move) labels
Sets the visibility of dumbbell markers
Sets the shape type of dumbbell markers
Sets the distance between dumbbell and markers
Sets the opacity of the dumbbell bar
Sets the width of the dumbbell bar
Sets the rule to color the dumbbell bar (options are 'greateValue', 'focus' or 'default')
An array that determines which property of the data is displayed in the tooltip
Sets the title for each label
Sets the formatting for the tooltip elements, EG %b
cursor is set to default
cursor is set to pointer
bars rendered on the y axis (column chart)
bars rendered on the x axis
Use this to add a helpful description of the chart
Use this to describe the biggest takeaway of the chart
Use this to describe the purpose of this particular chart
Use this to explain any controls or content on your page that affect or are affected by this chart
Gives the chart an alternate title to be used by screen readers
Optional key used to add an additional description to any element.
Use this to provide any statistical explanations that should be described by screen readers
Use this to describe special visual features of the chart, such as sorting, color grouping, etc
If true, includes data key names in voice over description of each element
If true, hides the data table button (but it is still available to screen reader users)
If true, disables validations for this chart
Defaults to null. Set to true if interacting with the elements in this chart affects your application. Otherwise, must be set to false.
Defaults to false. Set to true if you would like to display labels on small elements that are likely to overlap. Note, this could impact accessibility of your graphic.
Defaults to false. Set to true if you would like to remove automated stroke outlines from the chart, note, this could impact accessibility of your graphic.
Defaults to false. Set to true if you would like to remove textures from the chart, note, this could impact accessibility of your graphic.
Defaults to false. Set to true if you would like leverage our textures which are still undergoing research and development.

Defaults disabled property to false. May be set to true if accessibility.elementsAreInterface = false and suppressEvents = true. This will disable keyboard navigation and simplify chart instructions for screen reader users.
Defaults to false. Disabling may improve performance for charts with significant data changes or for accessibility preferences set by users.
Defaults to null. Set to true if interacting with the elements in this chart affects your application. Otherwise, must be set to false.
